result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy A Whiting was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court set restitution at $263.99 payable to K.T.S. and $519.00 payable to A.V.

Court ordered the defendant provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, restitution and surcharges including DNA by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

*8/29/2022 Honorable Laura Crivello signed Order.  Sentence credit amended to zero (0) days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case #20CF3287.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy A Whiting

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed and filed on 8/29/2022 which states "the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state zero (0) days of credit."
Signed and filed: Order Amending Judgment of Conviction
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Laura A. Crivello, Br. 36, for review. mag
Received and Filed: Attorney Stephen Sargent

Defendant Troy A Whiting in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Troy A Whiting in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS with 89 days credit, CONCURRENT to case # 20CF3287; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

Court ordered the defendant provide DNA sample.  Court set restitution at $263.99 payable to K.T.S. AND $519.00 payable to A.V.  Court ordered NO CONTACT with the victims. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, restitution, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

20 day appeal rights given.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Troy A Whiting not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense request an adjournment as the defendant was not produced for today's hearing. Case adjourned, branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Troy A Whiting not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties request an adjournment as defendant was not scheduled for zoom hearing today. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Troy A Whiting not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1

Defendant Troy A Whiting in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Troy A Whiting in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Troy A Whiting appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Troy A Whiting not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 4/15/2022. Defendant is in custody at Oshkosh Correctional. Needs to be produced for court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/15/22 @ 1:30p
